name: anathan
text: There's something really effective about the last two frames of this comic. At first I was like, "Why'd his suit get lighter in the last panel?" But now I think it adds some subtle effect. It's like he flickers in the last two frames.

name: caduceo
text: A comment left by caduceo was marked lame too many times and excluded. name: odei
text: Okay, you don't like the arc, have you commented every damn strip with this same message?

name: griggs_although
text: ...Boned?

name: nutmeg
text: A comment left by nutmeg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by furysama, magnificentpoof, achilleselbow, Satyr)

name: boredom_man
text: The reference you are missing is literacy

name: jlaw
text: exactly, if only a guy knew about magical realism in literature

name: cracker
text: If he had just heard of it even. He doesn't have to actually have read any books.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
Come on, man, be fair, he'd have to have at least read three.

Hell of interesting arc, though. I enjoy it, but I don't start finding it funny until they start getting into the inventions.

name: stormagnet
text: Way to reveal that you are of low mind, there.

name: atticusonline
text: 37 people disagree with you, none agree.

name: erinye
text: 37 HELENS DISAGREE

name: jaredwilde
text: A comment left by jaredwilde was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Rhadamanthus, sevenarts, Scorpio_nadir)

name: mugi
text:
I really WANT to appreciate the surreal, but I sometimes have a hard time of it, since I like rationality.

Even though I don't always enjoy it, I can tell that Onstad does it masterfully, and I'm glad that other people get it more than I do.

name: saint
text:
This is worse than my not knowing who Bella Lugosi was.

barely

name: tekende
text: No, it's not.

name: soticoto
text: Yes it is.

name: hellabosque
text: A comment left by hellabosque was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesler729, n00b, _cheesekayke, NDCaesar, Lumus, Jeef, achilleselbow)

name: stuart
text: waldo   klaus nomi

name: honesttom
text: Lonis is so happy to see you!

name: rawk5tar
text: The first Achewood strip I saw. I had to finish the story, as bizarre as it was. And I've been hooked since.

name: lawbot
text: This is a very good strip, and I am sad that it is so lowly-rated.

name: shineboxx
text: Somehow: the best part of this strip is (to me) the little dime-sized sun in the upper air, there in the first panel. Speaks volumes. Sings in the key of soul, you might say (I wouldn't, but hey).

name: jandruff
text: I second this. Reminds me of days when they seem to hum. I can't really explain it.

name: charchar
text: i read that as "dime-sized nun ." The odd part is that that made sense until I scrolled up to check again. Just thought you ought to know.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: I got a buck!
Nice Pete: A complicated gay man sold me a sandwich.
Little Nephew: da nhoo jabbah

"Krunk Drunkle Ray been hellz 'a some Niggard Lee at me l8ly, all sayinz' sum softserveproduktdatcomezouttahizazz 'bout response-ho-billity."

name: tekende
text:
Wow. This Nice Pete blog entry is wonderful.

"He prepared the sandwich well and something about him fascinated me. He wore his jeans in the modern low style where there is a hint of backside, and I was interested in that. I did not know how much he meant to show me, and that raised questions. You will know what I mean when I say that the sandwich is not where I will stop knowing him. I want to know what he meant by those pants and that coquetry. I think he meant quite a great deal, and I think he was out for adventure."

name: shutup_shutup
text: You there! What do you mean by those pants !?

name: lugosh
text: The 4th to 7th panels are a really neat effect. A nice diegetic paradox, if you will.

name: unsentletter
text:
[last two panels]

...

O_O

AIEEGH!!

name: cailetshadow
text: man don't smile at me like that I aint got no business with you none atall.

name: metatronatra
text: That dude looks like a Dr. Seuss character

name: sheer
text:
I joined the Army, and was in basic training when this arc went live. I had worked out a deal with my girlfriend at the time where she would print out the comic and send them to me, hidden amidst the standard loose-leafed missive.

Jesus crap, for months until I got home I only assumed that she'd been messing with me, and writing the strips herself.

name: aamzed
text: Why are people so fricken anal about everything.. It's part of the fricken story. Get over it.

name: japangea
text: This is actually the first achewood strip I saw. I came into it with no context, but I did laugh at the last panel and continued to read the comic. So, yeah, I think this arc is funny. Not that it has to be to be good.

name: ouroboros
text: Ray's eyebrow in the last panel defies the laws of physics.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: JESUS CHRIST, IT'S A HUMAN! GET IN THE CAR!

name: fady
text: Lonis' security system is to have intruders exit the building when they enter the door.
